<script type="text/javascript">
	 function loadScript(scriptURL){
        // load script
        var scriptTAG = document.createElement('script');
        scriptTAG.type = 'application/javascript';
        scriptTAG.async = true;
        scriptTAG.src = scriptURL;
        document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(scriptTAG);
      }

      function loadCSS(CSSURL){
        // load css
        var linkTAG = document.createElement('link');
        linkTAG.rel = "stylesheet";
        linkTAG.type = 'text/css';
        linkTAG.href = CSSURL;
        document.getElementsByTagName('head')[0].appendChild(linkTAG);
      }
      if(!navigator.onLine){
      	loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-base.min.css');
        loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-site.min.css');
        loadScript('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-base.min.js');

        // for event details template

      		loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-site/templates/clientlib-site-event-details.min.css');
      	}
        // for blog post template

      		loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/shared/clientlibs/clientlib-site/templates/clientlib-site-blog-post.min.css')
      	}
        // for DI Article and multimedia
        else if(templateType == "Deloitte_Insights_Article_And_Multimedia_Template"){
          loadCSS('/etc.clientlibs/deloitte-insights/clientlibs/clientlib-critical/clientlib-critical-di-insights-and-multimedia.min.css');

                          <section id="gen-zs-and-millennials-find-meaning-and-connection-online" class="fadesec fadeIn scroll-to">
                              <div class="article-bg-white article-margin-default article-count-four article-with-subheading">
                                  <div class="container">
                                      <div class="row article-heading-row">
                                          <div class="col-12">
                                              <h2>Gen Zs and Millennials find meaning and connection online</h2>
                                              <p>
                                                  For many people, digital media is not just for entertainment. It can also offer utility, foster community, and support emotional needs. Our survey shows younger
                                                  generations gravitate toward more interactive and social experiences: places and spaces where they can escape into other worlds, find community, share what—and
                                                  who—inspires them, cocreate adventures, and bring their friends along for the ride.
                                              </p>
                                              <hr>
                                          </div>
                                      </div>
                                      <div class="row key-findings-row" id="genz-frist-row">
                                          <div class="col-lg-8 key-col">
                                              <a class="article-box article-box-featured frame-datapoint" tabindex="0" data-title="weaving-a-tapestry-of-digital-media-experiences" data-analytics-label="gen-zs-and-millennials-find:weaving-a-tapestry-of-digital" download="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/digital_media_experiences1.png">
                                                  <img src="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/weaving.png" class="img-fluid" alt="Remote work could be becoming the rule rather than the exception">
                                                  <img src="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/final-open-weaving-new1.svg" class="modalImage d-none" alt="Weaving a tapestry of digital media experiences image">
                                                <div>
                                                  <h3 class="d-none">For many, online experiences become a part of life's tapestry</h3>
                                                  <p class="modalDesc d-none">Consumers weave together digital media experiences</p>
                                                  <div class="modalText d-none">
                                                      <p>
                                                          As online entertainment experiences become more interwoven, one activity feeds into another. Discovery has become a key part of consumers’ digital media
                                                          journeys. Led by Gen Z (1997–2009) and Millennial (1983–1996) behaviors, more and more people use social media and gaming as gateways to other content and
                                                          experiences.
                                                      </p>
                                                  </div>
                                                  <div class="linkText d-none"></div>
                                                  <div class="endNotes d-none"></div>
                                                  <div class="article-footer d-none">
                                                      <span class="pub-date">CHARTICLE</span>
                                                      <span class="black-dot"></span>
                                                      <span class="read-time">2 MIN READ</span>
                                                  </div>
                                                </div>
                                              </a>
                                          </div>
                                          <div class="col-lg-4 key-col">
                                              <a class="article-box article-box-featured frame-datapoint" tabindex="0" data-title="weaving-a-tapestry-of-digital-media-experiences" data-analytics-label="gen-zs-and-millennials-find:weaving-a-tapestry-of-digital" download="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/digital_media_experiences1.png">
                                                  <img src="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/final-open-weaving-new1.svg" class="modalImage d-none" alt="For many, online experiences become a part of life's tapestry image">
                                                <div>
                                                  <h3>For many, online experiences become a part of life's tapestry</h3>
                                                  <p class="modalDesc">Consumers weave together digital media experiences</p>
                                                  <div class="modalText d-none">
                                                      <p>
                                                          As online entertainment experiences become more interwoven, one activity feeds into another. Discovery has become a key part of consumers’ digital media
                                                          journeys. Led by Gen Z (1997–2009) and Millennial (1983–1996) behaviors, more and more people use social media and gaming as gateways to other content and
                                                          experiences.
                                                      </p>
                                                  </div>
                                                  <div class="linkText d-none"></div>
                                                  <div class="endNotes d-none"></div>
                                                  <div class="article-footer">
                                                      <span class="pub-date">CHARTICLE</span>
                                                      <span class="black-dot"></span>
                                                      <span class="read-time">2 MIN READ</span>
                                                  </div>
                                                </div>
                                              </a>
                                          </div>
                                          <div class="key-findings-row" id="genz-second-row">
                                              <!-- <div class="col-lg-6 key-col">
                                                                                                                                      <a

                                                                                                                                          data-title="the-big-divide"
                                                                                                                                          data-analytics-label="gen-zs-and-millennials-find:the-big-divide"
                                                                                                                                      >
                                                                                                                                          <img
                                                                                                                                              src="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/the-big-divide.png"
                                                                                                                                              class="img-fluid"
                                                                                                                                              alt="The big divide image"
                                                                                                                                          />
                                                                                                                                          <img

                                                                                                                                          <h3>The big divide: Age plays a huge role in digital media preferences</h3>
                                                                                                                                          <p class="modalDesc">Entertainment activity you enjoy more than others</p>
                                                                                                                                          <div class="modalText d-none">
                                                                                                                                              <p>
                                                                                                                                                  Watching TV shows and movies remains the most enjoyed entertainment activity among Gen X and older (41+) people
                                                                                                                                                  surveyed. But then, preferences change—significantly. Gen Z and Millennial respondents don’t have a No. 1, “go-to”
                                                                                                                                                  entertainment activity they enjoy; they have several. They enjoy playing video games and watching user-generated
                                                                                                                                                  content, both of which can deliver a blend of experiences and a diversity of content, from competition and
                                                                                                                                                  collaboration and grand adventures to music and shopping and personalized content that can whirl up into viral
                                                                                                                                                  moments.
                                                                                                                                              </p>
                                                                                                                                          </div>
                                                                                                                                          <div class="linkText d-none"></div>
                                                                                                                                          <div class="endNotes d-none"></div>
                                                                                                                                          <div class="article-footer">
                                                                                                                                              <span class="pub-date">CHARTICLE</span>

                                                                                                                                              <span class="read-time">2 MIN READ</span>

                                                                                                                                  </div> -->
                                              <div class="col-lg-6 key-col">
                                                  <a class="article-box article-box-featured frame-datapoint" tabindex="0" data-title="the-gaming-community" data-analytics-label="gen-zs-and-millennials-find:the-gaming-community-is-nuanced" download="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/the_gaming_community1.png">
                                                      <img src="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/the-gaming-community.png" class="img-fluid" alt="The gaming community is nuanced image">
                                                      <img src="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/final-the-gaming-community-datapoint2.svg" class="modalImage d-none" alt="Remote work could be becoming the rule rather than the exception">
                                                    <div>
                                                      <h3>The gaming community is nuanced, complex, and expansive</h3>
                                                      <p class="modalDesc">What makes someone a “committed gamer”?</p>
                                                      <div class="modalText d-none">
                                                          <p>
                                                              We’ve categorized people who play video games into two types: “casual gamers” or “committed gamers.” Casual gamers play less than five hours a week,
                                                              typically on their phones or tablets. Committed gamers play more than six hours a week and gravitate toward more immersive games more often played on gaming
                                                              consoles and computers. Men and boys still make up the majority of committed gamers, but at 38%, many women and girl gamers now fall into this category.
                                                              Across genders, people report meeting their social and emotional needs with video games.
                                                          </p>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div class="linkText d-none"></div>

                          <section id="amid-economic-uncertainty-consumers-zero-in-on-value" class="fadesec fadeIn scroll-to">
                              <div class="article-bg-light article-margin-default article-count-four article-with-subheading">
                                  <div class="container">
                                      <div class="row article-heading-row">
                                          <div class="col-12">
                                              <h2>Amid economic uncertainty, consumers zero in on value</h2>
                                              <p>
                                                  As digital media behaviors evolve, streaming video providers may face more challenges. Watching TV shows or movies at home remains dominant for Gen X and older
                                                  respondents, but across generations, there are frustrations around mounting costs. People are reevaluating what they’re getting for their time and money—and adjusting
                                                  accordingly.
                                              </p>
                                              <hr>
                                          </div>
                                      </div>
                  
                                      <div class="row key-findings-row" id="creators-frist-row">
                                          <div class="col-lg-8 key-col">
                                              <a class="article-box article-box-featured frame-datapoint" tabindex="0" data-title="the-big-divide" data-analytics-label="gen-zs-and-millennials-find:the-big-divide" download="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/the_big_divide1.png">
                                                  <img src="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/the-big-divide.png" class="img-fluid" alt="The big divide image">
                                                  <img src="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/final-the-big-divide-datapoint3.svg" class="modalImage d-none" alt="Remote work could be becoming the rule rather than the exception">
                                               <div>
                                                  <h3 class="d-none">The big divide: Age plays a huge role in digital media preferences</h3>
                                                  <p class="modalDesc d-none">Entertainment activities consumers enjoy most</p>
                                                  <div class="modalText d-none">
                                                      <p>
                                                          Watching TV shows and movies remains the most enjoyed entertainment activity among Gen X and older (41+) people surveyed. But then, preferences
                                                          change—significantly. Gen Z and Millennial respondents don’t have a No. 1, “go-to” entertainment activity they enjoy; they have several. They enjoy playing
                                                          video games and watching user-generated content, both of which can deliver a blend of experiences and a diversity of content, from competition and collaboration
                                                          and grand adventures to music and shopping and personalized content that can whirl up into viral moments.
                                                      </p>
                                                  </div>
                                                  <div class="linkText d-none"></div>
                                                  <div class="endNotes d-none"></div>
                                                  <div class="article-footer d-none">
                                                      <span class="pub-date">CHARTICLE</span>
                                                      <span class="black-dot"></span>
                                                      <span class="read-time">2 MIN READ</span>
                                                  </div>
                                               </div>
                                              </a>

                                                                                                                                          <div class="modalText d-none">

                                                      <div>
                                                          <h3>Once streaming video on demand (SVOD)’s biggest fans, Millennials are frustrated with subscriptions and driving churn</h3>
                                                      <p class="modalDesc">How Millennials may shake things up in 2023</p>
                                                      <div class="modalText d-none">
                                                          <p>
                                                              As Millennials mature—the oldest are turning 40 this year—their behaviors seem to be shifting. Though early adopters of SVOD services, Millennials surveyed
                                                              continue to show signs of subscription fatigue and cost-consciousness. At an average of US$54 per month, they spend the most on all their streaming video
                                                              subscriptions of any generation, but our survey shows they’re also the most likely to churn through SVOD services. This year’s survey shows Millennials are
                                                              looking more closely at what they’re getting for their money: They’re seeking entertainment options that come with lower costs and higher value
                                                              propositions.
                                                          </p>
                                                      </div>
                                                      <div class="linkText d-none"></div>

                          <section id="creators-on-social-media-foster-engagement-and-trust" class="fadesec fadeIn scroll-to">
                              <div class="article-bg-white article-margin-default article-count-two article-with-subheading">
                                  <div class="container">
                                      <div class="row article-heading-row">
                                          <div class="col-12">
                                              <h2>Creators on social media foster engagement—and trust</h2>
                                              <p>
                                                  Leveraging social media—and especially social media content creators—is another important part of the media puzzle for many people. Creators and influencers can
                                                  establish and build trust, grow communities, and drive awareness and excitement for brands, products, and content. These trends may have big implications for the future
                                                  of advertising.
                                              </p>
                                              <hr>
                                          </div>
                                      </div>
                  
                                      <div class="row key-findings-row" id="amid-frist-row">
                                          <div class="col-lg-6 key-col">
                                              <a class="article-box article-box-featured frame-datapoint" tabindex="0" data-title="online-content-creators-engender-brand" data-analytics-label="creators-on-social-media-foster:online-content-creators-engender-brand" download="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/online-content-creators-updated1.png">

                                                  <img src="https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/insights/us/USI-dev/2023/march/dmt_2023/assets/final-online-content-creators-datapoint1.svg" class="modalImage d-none" alt="Online content creators engender brand trust">
                  
                                              <div>
                                                  <h3>Online content creators engender brand trust and influence buying behaviors</h3>
                                                  <p class="modalDesc">The impact of influencers</p>
                                                  <div class="modalText d-none">
                                                      <p>
                                                          Younger respondents are most likely to trust and rely on UGC and content creators to inform their purchasing decisions. Creators have influence beyond a single
                                                          purchase: They have the power to grow communities, drive awareness for a brand or product, and establish and build trust. This is especially true among Gen Zs
                                                          and Millennials, who feel most connected to and influenced by their favorite creators.
                                                      </p>
                                                  </div>

                                                  <h2>Dig deeper into the findings</h2>
                                                  <p>
                                                      The 17th edition of the <span class="italic">Digital Media Trends Survey</span> was conducted by Deloitte’s Technology, Media & Telecommunications practice and
                                                      fielded by an independent research firm. The online survey of 2,020 US consumers was conducted in November 2022. All data is weighted back to the most recent Census
                                                      to give a representative view of what US consumers are doing. Take a deep dive into the findings and read or listen to the report.

                                  <div class="container">

    function getCookie(name) 
    {
        var dc = document.cookie;
        var prefix = name + "=";
        var begin = dc.indexOf("; " + prefix);
        if (begin == -1) {
            begin = dc.indexOf(prefix);
            if (begin != 0) return null;
        }
        else
        {
            begin += 2;
            var end = document.cookie.indexOf(";", begin);
            if (end == -1) {
                end = dc.length;
            }
        }
        return unescape(dc.substring(begin + prefix.length, end));
    }
